AL Ability: This Ability can only be activated while this Card is in the AL.
Balance Ability: This Ability can only be activated while this Card is on the field in the Balance Slot. This overwrites a Field Ability.
Banish: Send the card to the Shadow Realm.
Blocker: This card can Activate itâ€™s Blocker Ability when an enemy initiates an Attack. This card can redirect that attack to itself. Blocker can only be activated once per turn.
Break:
Send the card to the After Life.
A Phantom Breaks if it runs out of Health.
Break Impowering: The listed ability is activated after this card Breaks.
Breaker: When this card Battles another card, after the Battle resolves, that card has a Break applied to it.
Breaks: Send the card to the After Life.
Condition: The listed Condition is what must be done to activate the card.
Create: Add into play another specified card. (Not from any deck or hand but from outside the game. Similar to a token).
Cycle: Pay 1 Summoning Point. Draw another card and then place this card back randomly back into the deck.
Destructive: When this card Targets another card and that action results in that card Breaking, it is Destroyed instead.
Discard: Send the card to the After Life.
Discard Impowering: When this card is Discarded the attached Ability can be activated.
Discarded: Send the card to the After Life.
Dodge Roll:
When activated the card avoids a Targeted action and moves to an available Field Slot next to it.
If there is no Available field slot this Ability does not activate.
Environment Range:
Environment Range is what Players and cards an Environment's ability effects/is usable by.

When only one Player has an Environment in play both fields are in the Environment Range.

When both players have an Environment in play, only their side of the field is in their own Environment Range.
Equip Card: This card is attached to the selected card and placed in a Spirit/Counter Card Slot. It's ability is applied to the Equipped card until this card leaves the field. If the Equipped card is destroyed then this card is Discarded.
Equipped: This Ability is applied to the card equipped to by this card.
Excavate:
Look at a certain number of cards from the top of your deck.
Usually to Draw a chosen card.
Field Ability: This Ability can only be activated while this Card is on the field.
Fragile: After this card Battles, it has a Break applied to it.
Hand Ability: This Ability can only be activated while this Card is in the hand.
Marked: The card will have an Ability applied to it at a later point or after a Condition is met.
Negate: Stop a game action from happening. Such as stopping an Ability from Activating.
On Summon: The attaching Ability happens when the card is Summoned.
Redirect: Choose a new target for the Game Action (Ability/Attack).
Resurrect: Summon a Phantom from the After Life. For it's SP Cost.
Seal:
The card is locked into the location that it is Sealed in.
It cannot be taken out of that location or otherwise interacted with -- without specifically an Ability that interacts with Sealed cards.
Sealed:
The card is locked into the location that it is Sealed in.
It cannot be taken out of that location or otherwise interacted with -- without specifically an Ability that interacts with Sealed cards.
Search: Find a card from the designated deck to add to select. Most often drawing a card from the main deck.
Shadow Realm Ability: This Ability can only be activated while this Card is in the Shadow Realm.
Shielded:
The first damage this card would take is negated.
This only applied once per Shielded application. Often meaning once per summon.
Stat Swap: Swap the current Attack and Health of a Phantom.
Stats: Both the Attack and Health of a Phantom.
Stealth: This card cannot be Targeted by the opponent until it Activates an Ability or declares an Attack.
Sturdy:
The first time this Phantom would Break, that Break is Negated.
If this happens as a result of the Phantom losing all its Health, it stays on zero health and the Zero Health Rules apply.
Summon Binding: This card cannot be Unsummoned by the Player.
Summoner Battle Damage: The Player takes Summoner Damage in Battle for all excess Attack beyond their Phantom's Health.
Summoner Damage: Any damage that is applied to the Summoner as a result of Attacks or Battle.
Target: This card Targets a Card for the ability to be applied to.
Targeted: This card Targets a Card for the ability to be applied to.
Token:
A card treated as a Phantom.
If details are not given for a token, it is to be treated as a Level 0 Phantom without an Ability, 0-Stats, and no Archetype.
Unsummon:
On your turn, send your own Ally Phantom to the AY and gain the Summoning Points of that card's current Field SP/Level back.
You cannot Unsummon a card the turn it has Battled.
